summary: The Pipeline Safety Engagement Act of 2025 directs the Secretary of Transportation to rename the Community Liaison Services within the Office of Pipeline Safety as the Office of Public Engagement. This new office will proactively engage with stakeholders (public, operators, etc.) to raise awareness of pipeline safety, promote safety programs, inform the public about regulations, and assist with inquiries. The act mandates public access to the office's activities and information and requires a report to Congress on its implementation within 18 months.
